title: Capella to install optical terminals on imaging satellites to share data with DoD space agency
summary: Capella Space will begin installing optical communications terminals on synthetic-aperture radar (SAR) satellites in 2022 as part of a campaign to quickly deliver data to the Pentagon Space Development Agency’s new National Defense Space Architecture.

title: NASA’s stalwart Mars helicopter is back and better than ever
summary: Cumulatively, Ingenuity has now flown more than 3 km across the surface of Mars.

title: Japan’s Epsilon 5 rocket launches nine small satellites
summary: Japan’s solid-fuel Epsilon 5 rocket successfully put nine small satellites into orbit Nov. 9, including an orbital debris removal technology demonstrator.

title: Virgin Galactic adds 100 customers after resuming ticket sales
summary: Virgin Galactic executives said they’ve seen strong interest from customers as the company restarts sales of tickets on its suborbital vehicles, even though those customers may have an extended wait until they fly.

title: NASA to provide Artemis update
summary: NASA will provide an update on its plans for the Artemis program as the new head of the agency’s exploration efforts works to get up to speed on both near-term and long-term priorities.

title: SpaceX crew capsule brings astronauts home after nearly 200 days in orbit
summary: Two NASA astronauts and mission specialists from Japan and France closed out a 199-day space flight Monday on a SpaceX crew capsule, departing the International Space Station and riding their Dragon spacecraft through a scorching re-entry and splashdown in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Crew Dragon lands safely, despite one parachute inflating slowly [Updated]
summary: We're going to miss Thomas Pesquet's spicy memes from space.

title: Earth needs a ‘mission control’ to manage climate data collected from space
summary: Much of the critical data used to track climate change and its impact on Earth is collected by satellites in space. But all that data needs to be better analyzed in order to better cope with the climate crisis, said Ellen Stofan, undersecretary for science and research at the Smithsonian Institution.

title: Japan’s Epsilon launches RAISE-2 and eight secondary satellites
summary: Japan has finally launched its small satellite launcher Epsilon to deliver nine satellites to orbit. Notably, this includes the RAISE-2 technology demonstrator.

title: Space Force wants a more detailed picture of what other nations are doing in space
summary: The U.S. Space Force needs better space situational awareness to understand what rivals are doing in orbit, said Lt. Gen. Nina Armagno at the ASCEND 2021 conference.
